Each May and June, after an exhausting migration for many bird species, a group of volunteers travel the roads of Orange County to listen for who has chosen to make a nest in our neighborhood. The [mini bird breeding survey](http://rhwiley.bio.unc.edu/mbbs/), a regional version of the [long-running national survey](https://www.pwrc.usgs.gov/bbs/), has tracked local bird populations since 1999. Such systematicaslly collected data makes it possible to examine trends in bird biodiversity on a local scale. The following table shows species identified as of [local concern by the New Hope Audubon Society](https://www.newhopeaudubon.org/conservation/species-of-local-concern/).


```{r, class = "bio_image", echo = FALSE}
species_table <- function(table_data, details_column,
                          width,
                          colnames){
  tab <- datatable(
  cbind(' ' = '&oplus;', table_data), 
  colnames  = colnames,
  width  = width,
  escape = FALSE,
  options = list(
    searching  = FALSE,
    paging     = FALSE,
    bInfo      = FALSE,
    columnDefs = list(
      list(targets = c(3,4,5), className = "text-center"),
      list(targets = c(2, details_column, 6, 7), searchable = TRUE),
      list(targets = c(0, details_column, 6, 7), visible = FALSE),
      list(orderable = FALSE, className = 'details-control', targets = c(1, details_column))
    )
  ),
  callback = JS(sprintf("
  table.column(1).nodes().to$().css({cursor: 'pointer'});
  
  var format = function(d) {
    return d[%s];
  };
  
  table.on('click', 'td.details-control', function() {
    var td = $(this), row = table.row(td.closest('tr'));
    if (row.child.isShown()) {
      row.child.hide();
      td.html('&oplus;');
    } else {
      row.child(format(row.data())).show();
      td.html('&CircleMinus;');
    }
  });
  
  $('ul').on( 'click', 'a.localConcern', function () {
  table
      .columns( 6 )
      .search(  true )
      .draw();
  });
  
  $('ul').on( 'click', 'a.sigTrends', function () {
  table
      .columns( 7 )
      .search(  true )
      .draw();
  });
  
  $('ul').on('click', 'a.all', function() {
     table
       .columns( )
       .search( '' )
       .draw();
    });
  
  ", details_column)
  )) 
  tab$dependencies <- append(tab$dependencies, htmlwidgets:::getDependency("sparkline"))
  tab
}

species_table(
  table_dt, 5, 
  width    = NULL,
  colnames = c("", "Common name", "Trend", "Rate of Change", "", "", ""))

```

```{r, echo = FALSE}
wdtrsh <- filter(mbbs_results, common_name == "Wood Thrush") %>% pull(log_rate)
wdtrsh <- abs(round((exp(wdtrsh) - 1)*100, 1))
```

Certain iconic specialist species such as the Wood Thrush have declined by as much as `r wdtrsh`% annually over the last 20 years. Anyone who has enjoyed a summer hike in [one of our local parks](https://gis.orangecountync.gov:8443/TrailsAndParks/default.html) will certainly recognize the [Wood Thrushâ€™s flutely song](https://www.allaboutbirds.org/guide/Wood_Thrush/sounds). While loss and fragmentation of the eastern deciduous forest has certainly contribute to Wood Thrush decline, the [winter range and travel routes of migratory birds are equally important](https://insider.si.edu/2016/01/loss-breeding-grounds-north-america-likely-cause-wood-thrush-decline/), demonstrating how changes to a local ecosystem can have global consequences.

#### Recommended Actions

Actions for BOCC

* Install bird proofing on windows of county buildings
* Encourage use of native plants in landscaping and reduce amount of lawn/mown areas.

Actions for citizens

* Get involved with science: MBBS, New Hope Audubon, Chapel Hill Bird Club, inaturalist
* Plant native trees: https://projects.ncsu.edu/goingnative/howto/index.html
